appearance.Attractiveness: Varies; historically, bloated corpses were mistaken for vampires

Dracula: Varies
Female Vampires: Beautiful to the point of hypnotic
appearance.When Dead: Dust, except for newborn vampires, who become corpses

appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, they have a predatory look compared to normal humans
Ordinary but often somewhat above average
Ordinary but often somewhat above average

appearance.Skin Colour: Pale, smooth, marble-like, gets whiter with age
appearance.Attractiveness: All are beautiful. The transformation enhances their beauty. The older and stronger they get, the less human they look but still remain beautiful.
Adorable to all, intimately only with other rabbits.

appearance.Film: Implied that only digital cameras work

appearance.Shadow: Yes (No in original novels. Dhampir shadow is faint)

appearance.Attractiveness: Can make themselves beautiful or hideous
Ordinary. Become quite ugly when about to attack and fangs appear.

appearance.Setting: The Vampire Diaries (Novel and television series)
appearance.Attractiveness: typically beautiful (true vampire face is shown while feeding or thinking about blood; blood vessels under the eyes swell and turn red, eyes turn red, fangs grow)
appearance.When Dead: Gray corpse with swelled superficial veins (TV series), regular corpse (most vampires in books), dust (very old vampires in books)

appearance.Reflection: Yes - Lasombra, however, don't have them
appearance.Film: Yes for those with a reflection, No in other cases
appearance.Attractiveness: Varies by bloodline, individual, and discipline. Most notably, Nosferatus are hideously deformed, while Toreadors are beautiful.

appearance.When Dead: Dust, can be revived with blood

appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but some bloodlines seem to get more attractive with age, some less, and many vampires are attractive as this was the reason they were sired
Ancient vampires were alluring while human turned vampire evolutions became more grotesque.

appearance.When Dead: Burn in blue flames or turn to dust

appearance.Setting: Buffy the Vampire Slayer TV series (1997)
appearance.Attractiveness: Can appear as normal humans. However, when feeding or angry, they reveal their true vampire visage where their eyes turn yellow, their brow extends and they grow fangs and pointed teeth. Extremely old vampires are unable to take a human face.

appearance.Reflection: Yes, even if the vampire himself turns invisible

appearance.When Dead: Catch on fire, then turn to dust

appearance.Reflection: Faint reflection that disappears with age

appearance.Film: Cannot be recorded on film (vampire) or are blurry on film (half-vampire)
appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but vampaneze subrace become swollen and discolored from overfeeding
Steve Niles mentioned that they have an alien-like appearance. They are also described as being gruesome yet attractive.
Ordinary, but appearance will deteriorate if deprived of blood. Appearance can also morph, and vaguely implied to be able to sprout wings.
Ordinary, but some are above average.
Above average when in human form, but they turn into a winged bat/demon-like creature, which is possibly their true appearance.

appearance.Skin Colour: Pale, harder than diamonds, sparkles in sunlight
appearance.Fangs: No, their teeth are sharp and serrated and coated in venom, but not pointed
appearance.When Dead: Corpses attempt to reconstruct themselves, unless burned to ash

appearance.Fangs: Yes, grows even bigger when attacking people
appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but the "pill-vampires" turn monstrous when attacking people, while the supervampire shapeshifts into a demonic creature to hunt. The original vampires look human all the time. All the vampires have orange eyes that turn red when their bloodlust is awakened. The vampires also have exposed veins.
Moroi are beautiful and Strigoi are beautiful too, but have red-ringed iris around their pupils
Depends: red fledglings are described as gross, but once they choose to be good and become an adult they can be alluring
Tall, with a "predatory appearance"; baseline humans possess an instinctive panic response to them
Ordinary, but humans can develop more attraction to them by drinking their blood, and also with the power to "Glamour" ordinary humans into enticement

appearance.Film: Do not appear on film or video

appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but many are above average
Very Beautiful. When enraged its eyes turn black.

Normal, but with pallid skin and yellow eyes. However, if deprived of blood they become deformed, their ears grow, they lose their hair, grow claws and wings and become bat-like creatures called "Subsiders"
Usually normal, but severely distorted and animalistic when enraged
Slimy and batlike, but with an attractive human "costume"
Normal, but with red eyes and wings.
Somewhat attractive. Demonic when enraged or in pain
Transformation turns them into the peak of their beauty

appearance.Skin Colour: Gray, except for Saya who is ordinary
appearance.Attractiveness: Saya is ordinary, the other Chiropterans are monstrous, but can look like normal humans

appearance.Skin Colour: Ordinary, except fail chiropterans that have gray skin
appearance.Fangs: Only fail chiropterans and Chevaliers when they shape shift
appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, except for fail chiropterans that are monstrous

appearance.Fangs:
Full Vampires: Yes
Half-Vampires: No, teeth become serrated during transformation.

appearance.Attractiveness: Beautiful, unless they absorb other monsters, in which case they became monstrous.
Ordinary, but the color of their eyes can change when they are angry or sad.
Beautiful, except for the Level E, which look like weak and sick humans.

appearance.Reflection: In Castlevania: Lords of Shadow they do not have reflection
appearance.Attractiveness: The Elder Vampires are beautiful, while the Vampire Warriors are bat-like creatures because they don't know how to shapeshift.

appearance.Reflection: If a vampire were to look into a mirror, their soul would be imprisoned in it. Breaking the mirror causes the vampire's soul to "break", killing the vampire

appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but their bodies are in constant degeneration.

appearance.Skin Colour: Vampires ordinary, but Kowloon Children are pale
appearance.Attractiveness: Vampires ordinary, but Kowloon Children have feral appearance
Feral-looking versions of humans; however, they can look more human if they drink human blood. Vampire Lords can assume a bat-like appearance.
appearance.When Dead: Corpse, but gradually crumbles to dust

appearance.Setting: My Babysitter's a Vampire Full vampires
appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary, but when angry, or about to fight someone their fangs grow, and their eyes either glow a yellowish color; or a dark blueish purple color.
Old vampires are ordinary in appearance, but new ones are hideous.
His true form is demonic, but he can change into human form.
Varies, but new vampires look like sick people
Different monstrous form, but they can look human
They come in all shapes and sizes

appearance.Reflection: In silver-backed mirrors their image is blurred and distorted

appearance.Skin Colour: Pale, becomes paler the longer a vampire goes without feeding
appearance.Reflection: reflection becomes less opaque the longer a vampire goes without feeding
appearance.Attractiveness:
Belial: three horns on their heads
Ba'al: short and goblinlike
Moloch: bull-like head, hooves and claws

appearance.Reflection: Yes, but their eyes reflect black instead of red
appearance.Film: Yes, but their eyes are depicted as black instead of red
appearance.Attractiveness: Ordinary but often somewhat above average
likely greater as happened with Julius Jones at the end
Master vampires are hideous, but infected vampires are ordinary
Emaciated, increasingly nonhuman with age, eventually quadrupedal

appearance.Skin Colour: Pale, with scales or flaked skin
appearance.Attractiveness: Monstrous with reptilian, bat or rat characteristics

appearance.Film: There's an app that does get them to show up on film

appearance.Attractiveness: Blood Mary is beautiful, but her true form and her underlings are monstrous; First Borns can take on a human appearance

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal; ash, hawthorn, or oak preferred

weaknesses.Other: Destroying a Blood Mirror turns all the vampires of a clan in human and kill the old vampires

weaknesses.Sunlight: Only weakened during daylight hours, though not at midday (at which time of day he becomes stronger)
weaknesses.Other: Dracula has the mind of a child and is very obsessive; his own psychic powers can be used to hunt him

weaknesses.Sunlight: But it greatly weakens their powers
weaknesses.Other: Prolonged abstinence from blood can lead to asphyxiation and possibly death

weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal; older vampires have higher tolerances
weaknesses.Fire: Fatal (Stronger vampires have much higher resilience)
weaknesses.Other: Blood from an already-dead creature induces temporary deathlike state.
Gets soggy in milk
Werewolf bite

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal. Must be wood or silver

weaknesses.Decapitation: It paralyzes them, but it isn't fatal

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal, but will recover if the stake is removed
weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal, will survive very short exposure

weaknesses.Other: They also can be killed by EDTA and the Daystar virus
Their bodies start to consume themselves if they are unable to feed for a couple of hours
Charcoal

weaknesses.Sunlight: When blood touches their ashes they will regenerate.
Fatal (although the incarnation featured in the series is immune to sunlight)
Not fatal. Weak during daylight hours. After a few years they begin to develop a resistance towards it, Other than that their eyes still react the same

weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Holy water is fatal in large quantities
weaknesses.Invitation: Invitation makes vampire immune to weaknesses and vampire characteristics

weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Boosts mental resistance if the user truly believes it works
weaknesses.Other: Heart extraction. Prolonged period without feeding

weaknesses.Setting: The Vampire Diaries TV Series, Originals
weaknesses.Stake: only a stake made of White Wood or its ashes
weaknesses.Other: When an Original dies, all vampires in their blood line also die

weaknesses.Setting: The Vampire Diaries TV Series, Others
weaknesses.Other: Heart extraction. Werewolf bite; Vervain and some magical objects weaken them.
If they don`t pass the Change when they are fledglings, sometimes they die

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal, but only if made of wood. Older vampires require larger amounts of wood.
weaknesses.Garlic: Shown as a prop on-screen, but never utilized
weaknesses.Other: Some poisons and drugs can affect them

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal, but only if made of wood
weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal; Younger vampires can survive short exposure, older vampires have lower tolerances; Fae/Fairy blood can eliminate weakness to sun for a short period
weaknesses.Invitation: Yes (Only in private residences owned by humans)
weaknesses.Other: Hepatitis D and Maenad Blood can weaken them. Exsanguination is mentioned to be fatal.

weaknesses.Invitation: Fatal, if invite remains absent for long enough
weaknesses.Other: Blood with cáncer hurts them, but it is still nutritious
Anything that would kill a human

weaknesses.Stake: Turns the Strigoi into a Moroi if silver and charmed with spirit

weaknesses.Sunlight: No; possible dependency on moonlight – torpid and vulnerable during new moon
Generally fatal; some vampires are immune
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Any religious iconography if wielded by a true believer

weaknesses.Sunlight: Non-fatal, but finds it extremely unpleasant
weaknesses.Silver: Blessed silver weakens Alucard, but does not kill him. Fatal for other vampires.
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: It is not fatal, but it weakens them

weaknesses.Sunlight: Highly susceptible to sunburns, eventually fatal
weaknesses.Other: The blood of snakes, rats, and cats are poisonous to them

weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal; certain disciplines can make them resistant or immune
weaknesses.Fire: Fatal; certain disciplines can make them resistant or immune
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Immune unless with flaw or when wielded by someone with true faith

weaknesses.Stake: Yes (Only way to permanently kill a vampire)
weaknesses.Sunlight: No (More sensitive to sunlight and prefer to avoid it)
weaknesses.Garlic: Yes (Causes fangs to appear, watery eyes, and sneezing)
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Yes (Doesn't work on old and powerful ones.)
weaknesses.Other: Werewolf blood can kill them

weaknesses.Sunlight: No (more sensitive to sunlight and prefer to avoid it)
weaknesses.Garlic: Yes (causes fangs to appear, watery eyes, and sneezing)
weaknesses.Other: Werewolf blood mutates them, consuming the juniper plant immobilize them and a mysterious new flu strain kill them
Dead man's blood can paralyze them, and the Colt, angelic touch and Vamp-Tonite can kill them

weaknesses.Sunlight: It makes them progressively weaker and causes severe sunstroke
weaknesses.Silver: Yes, it is toxic and can eventually kill if left in too long

weaknesses.Other: Hive tethered to a specific location shortly after the queen is turned, unless she swarms; the touch of a soulless or metanatural turns them human temporarily

weaknesses.Decapitation: Fatal, but Vorador was resurrected after his execution
weaknesses.Drowning: Fatal to all except Rahabim vampires
weaknesses.Fire: Fatal to most if not all
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Vulnerable to Hylden glyphs and Moebius's staff
weaknesses.Running Water: Fatal to most, but Vampires in Blood Omen 1 can "buy" a resistance to some forms of water, such as rain or snow
weaknesses.Other: The Nexus Stone could send Kain in a coma for centuries; and sonic waves and the Moebius's Staff weaken vampires
Alcohol causes severe burns on contact, much like Holy Water in other settings

weaknesses.Sunlight: They can became immune if they absorb blood with the Corvinus Strain
weaknesses.Drowning: They can became immune if they absorb blood with the Corvinus Strain
weaknesses.Other: Werewolf bite can kill them

weaknesses.Sunlight: Burns, death if exposed too long
weaknesses.Garlic: Only aggravates highly developed olfactory nerves

weaknesses.Other: Starvation, suffocation, great levels of violence, leprosy or the Black Death also kill them

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal; older vampires have higher tolerances
weaknesses.Fire: Fatal; older vampires have higher tolerances

weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal (except under the treatments of Dr. Julia Hoffman)

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal, although the supervampire had to be killed through a combination of several vampire weaknesses
weaknesses.Sunlight: Implied; the supervampire was killed by strong light after being staked

weaknesses.Other: The opposite of the emotion that they feed on

weaknesses.Holy Symbols: Affected by the faith of the user, not the inherent properties of the object; any holy symbol will work
weaknesses.Other: It is mentioned that they have the weaknesses as described in Bram Stoker's novel.

weaknesses.Holy Symbols: They are less affected than the Black Court
weaknesses.Other: Cutting their stomach open drains the blood they've eaten, this weakens them.

weaknesses.Sunlight: Weakened through sun exposure, a parasol seems to be enough protection, though
weaknesses.Running Water: Yes, even rain is a problem
weaknesses.Other: roasted soybeans

weaknesses.Stake: Fatal, but only through the heart

weaknesses.Other: The Bloodgem and the Montesi Formula incantation can kill them

weaknesses.Sunlight: No, but light-shy and tends toward nocturnal activity
weaknesses.Holy Symbols: No intrinsic aversion to religion in general, but "crucifix glitch" caused problems with crosses
weaknesses.Invitation: Cannot approach any construction with right angles while eyes are open due to "crucifix glitch"; legend may have arisen from this condition
weaknesses.Arithmomania: Possible - altered brain structure provides omnisavantic pattern-matching and analytical skills
weaknesses.Other: Neurological "crucifix glitch" causes lethal seizures when perpendicular lines fill more than 30 degrees of visual field; seizures can be prevented by "anti-Euclidean drugs"

The blood of one Queen can kill anything that her sister has created
They have to eat normal food alongside blood or they die

weaknesses.Sunlight: But it greatly weakens their powers
weaknesses.Other: Killing a vampire kills their entire clan if done during the first 48 hours of the creation of a new vampire
Pumpkin smell is repulsive to them, werewolf scratch take away their powers, and vampires powers are useless against plastic

weaknesses.Sunlight: They can take a special medicine that toughens their skin, allowing them to walk around in the daylight

weaknesses.Other: The light of a flashlight is also fatal

weaknesses.Sunlight: Direct sunlight only; a simple parasol is enough to render the sun's light merely irritating
weaknesses.Other: Powerless against ghosts

weaknesses.Sunlight: Only cause burns and not actually harm them
weaknesses.Other: Only anti-vampire weapons can kill a Pureblood
Sea salt and spells hurt them, and a broken heart due to love kill them

weaknesses.Decapitation: Only if they are not powerful enough to regenerate

weaknesses.Sunlight: Fatal; powerful Dead Apostles can withstand it

weaknesses.Other: They can die in any normal way

weaknesses.Invitation: Only to enter the Special Zone

weaknesses.Other: They are afraid of white eyes painted on black dogs

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Wolf, bat (also giant bat), dust, fog - possibly dog as well. Can also impersonate Jonathan Harker. Can impersonate a coachman and a doorman (though it is not known if he only used darkness to disguise himself or a little magic as well in addition to that darkness)
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: The hunters track Dracula through his telepathic link with Mina
supernatural powers.Psychokinesis: Improbable, as he would then have carried his boxes on his own (though he might still have been too weak to use that hypothetical magical power)
supernatural powers.Pyrokinesis: Plausible, since he started a massive fire and the characters who were not present when he did it simply had to guess he may have used a match, but they cannot prove anything.
supernatural powers.Other: Control of nocturnal animals, wolves and rats mentioned specifically. At least one Vampire (if not all) is able to shrink to fit under a door. Hypothetical array of other powers (due to former magical scholarship - undocumented, and very briefly mentioned by Dr Van Helsing). Lizard-like climbing abilities.
Rats and plague follow the Vampire
Vampires can walk on walls and ceilings
Most are able to walk on walls and ceilings. Children of the Millennia can cause blood vessels to rupture. All vampires have enhanced memories.
Gifted vampires can have a variety of different abilities.
No

supernatural powers.Enhanced Senses: Yes. Vampires can also see in ultraviolet
supernatural powers.Unnatural Healing: Yes; also, Frost/La Magra merger regenerates lost limbs instantly (see "other")
supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Only Dracula and La Magra, the latter can shed his skin, turning into a ball of fire to methodically stalk his prey. (Gained from the Ligaroo tribe)
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Only La Magra, which can control minds, matter and the elements. (Gained from the Faustinas tribe)
supernatural powers.Other: Deacon Frost, when merged with La Magra was impervious to silver, able to day-walk due to Blade's blood, and can instantly turn any human in his path into vampires.

supernatural powers.Flight: As a bat or as a "human"
supernatural powers.Other: Overcome inherent weaknesses with psychological conditioning
All Moroi have an extra power: water, earth, air and sometimes spirit.

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Only if they had the power before they turned.
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Can "Glamour" humans, erase memories and bend their will
supernatural powers.Other: Can feel the emotions of whoever has drank blood from them, such as if they are in danger. They can also feel when their "maker" is in trouble, and a maker can feel the same thing for their progeny (vampire children). Vampire blood can heal humans, and has drug-like effects.
Can climb any surface and may hang from the ceiling to sleep
They can control the elements, animals and the weather

supernatural powers.Flight: Only in the first episode; retconned soon after
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Vampires can compel humans. Originals can compel vampires, vampire/werewolf hybrids and humans.
supernatural powers.Other: Dream Manipulation. Vampire blood heals humans. Can "turn off humanity"

supernatural powers.Flight: If they have wings in their true form
supernatural powers.Other: Gifted vampires can have a variety of different abilities

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Gifted; Zerenski could turn into a flock of bats and Rayne gained the ability to become a raven
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Gifted; Rayne's ghostly double can enter and control others
supernatural powers.Other: Gifted vampires and dhampir, like Kagan or Rayne, can have a variety of extra abilities others may not have
Gifted vampires can have a variety of different abilities
They can transfer their consciousness from one human host to another
The elders have different special abilities
Gifted bloodlines can have a variety of different abilities

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Bat; standard form can grow claws
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Powerful hypnosis; can control beasts or men, rewrite memories; requires eye contact
supernatural powers.Other: Can walk on walls and ceilings in defiance of gravity; able to induce lasting paralysis in beasts or men.
Can swap locations with their Bat familiars, making it appear as if they turned into the animal

supernatural powers.Immortal: Very long-lived, "shadow form" is immortal or nearly so
supernatural powers.Other: Most or all of their powers derive from manipulation of chance
Some of them can do magic
No

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: Wolf, bat, fog, can shapeshift into other humans
supernatural powers.Other: Can cast spells of illusion, can possibly turn invisible or teleport
Can control certain mortals

supernatural powers.Shapeshifting/Absorption: They can shapeshift into a bat (they can't do this during the day)

supernatural powers.Immortal: Immortal, or at least capable of reaching great ages
supernatural powers.Psychic Powers: Can relay communication from necromancer pilot
supernatural powers.Other: Extraordinarily good climbers; non-sapient, telepathically piloted by a necromancer (bloodthirsty mindlesss monsters, otherwise)
They can teleport and some have special abilities
They are able to walk on walls and ceilings
Can control bats

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Not stated by author but theories exist that he has a family
Baby vampires are born dead and must be reanimated

reproduction and feeding.Inhabited by demons: Yes (Although their actions are not controlled by the spirit inhabiting them.)
reproduction and feeding.Diet: May feed on animal blood, but it is less nutritious.

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Male vampires can reproduce with female humans

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Can consume human or animal blood
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Affects the pleasure centers of the brain

reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Extremely rarely, something goes horribly wrong in the transition from human to vampire, resulting in a “Revenant”, a malformed zombie-like creature. These "mistakes" are unpredictable not understood.. Some Pure-Bloods are born with an anomaly where a vampire became a ghoulish being without any regenerative capability

reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Inject a neurotoxin to paralyze their victims

reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Scratches

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via consumption of vampire blo: The human being turned must be buried alive in the ground afterward
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Can consume human, animal, or artificial blood

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: The victim becomes a mindless vampire

reproduction and feeding.Setting: The Vampire Diaries (Novel and television series)
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: If killed while vampire blood is still in the system
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Novels: Human or animal blood; in the television series: human, animal and vampire blood; food gives them little nutrients
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Magic ritual

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood and food, but only blood gives them the nutrients they need
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Induces emotional and physical euphoria
Induces emotional and physical euphoria
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: If Moroi purposefully kills another person while feeding turns into a Strigoi

reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Pleasurable for both human and vampyre, and may lead to a strong bond, called "Imprinting"
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Some teenagers are changed into vampyres when adolescent hormones trigger a strand of DNA. If they pass the Change, they become blue vampyres, otherwise if they die they can be somehow resurrected and become Red Vampyres

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Provided the other is a virgin of the opposite sex; otherwise creates ghouls
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: FREAKs (artificial vampires) are created by chips implanted in their bodies

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: Turn the human into a made vampire; however if the human doesn't survive, becomes a ghoul
If the human doesn't survive, becomes a ghoul

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human and animal blood, can drink any beverages that human can

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Yes, but it creates humans with vampire characteristics, not new vampires
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Injects a venom that has a paralyzing effect on people

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Only young male vampires can reproduce with a human mother, may cause extreme birth defects
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human and lycanthrope blood feeds them, they can also drink animal blood but is not a sufficient diet

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Except for "thin bloods", those of the 15th (and sometimes 14th) Generation removed from Caine; the offspring are natural ghouls, not vampires
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via consumption of vampire blo: The victim must be drained to the point of death, otherwise it just creates a ghoul, a semi-immortal human
reproduction and feeding.Inhabited by demons: All vampires must contend with "the Beast", an Id-like entity
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Can consume human or animal blood, need at least 1 point (~400 ml) /day; some can eat food
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Victims usually entranced
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Consumption of vampire blood without draining makes a human effectively immortal, and gives them some powers, but does not make them a vampire. The effect wears off in about a month without subsequent doses.

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Vampires: Few drops of human blood and human food; they can even drink alcoholic beverages. vampaneze: all of the human blood

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via consumption of vampire blo: The human must be near death

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Only females can create new vampires, and only if the recipient has enough soul; it doesn't happen with every feeding, see notes
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Making a new vampire involves simultaneously feeding (with feeder fangs) and injecting blood into the new vampire (with maker fangs); it doesn't always work.

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: No. Kain is able to bite (even kill) his enemies without infecting them
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: Ancients infected humans with blood as did Human Hybrids besides Kain. The vampires of Kain's empire were never documented.
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Kain himself was created using the Heart of Darkness and Necromancy. Because of this Kain had to create through a form of Necromancy, "breathing" his soul into a corpse, animating it and calling its soul back from the underworld. The soul was then itself vampiric, infected by Kain's.

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: A vampire can have one single human child
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: More or less complicated procedure, implied that the victim has to agree, but might be unnecessary

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Only full vampires. Half-Human variants are sterile
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Young vampires and human-vampire hybrids can consume human food. Loss of taste for human food occurs in normal vampires at puberty; food begins to taste like sand. Following puberty, vampires and hybrids develop different 'tastes' for different (usually negative) traits/emotions in humans.
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Temporary removal of trait/emotion in bitten human.
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Human-vampire hybrids do not need to feed as often, but feeding causes the hybrid to be temporarily affected by all the weaknesses of full vampires.

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood from a live human and food
Human blood from a live human

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Vampires are sterile, and can cause the death of mortals if intercourse is attempted
Males can have one egg son, Females can produce a multitude of eggs in a mass birth
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Blood and human flesh, but other creatures and human food too during parties
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Inhaling or absorbing the cloud of spores from the ‘mushrooms’ or by absorbing a leech’s egg

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via consumption of vampire blo: Blood is given before death to create a half-vampire

reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Witch's curse and there is a debate about that the vampiric energy of Barnabas was transferred, curing Barnabas & bringing Adam to life

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Born basically human, become vampire after first feeding (can become fully human instead)
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Victims are sexually aroused, or terrified, depending on what emotion the vampire feeds off of
Has an addictive effect on victims
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Multi-stage process; potential vampire is infected, and gains some powers, then becomes a vampire after first feeding

reproduction and feeding.Inhabited by demons: Vampires are considered a kind of devil, but are not possessed

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood; blood from animals or other vampires gives them little nutrients

reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Can also be created by applying retroviral gene therapy to baseline humans

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Queens: Human or their Chevaliers blood; food gives them nutrients, but diminishes their powers, chiropterans: human blood, but chevaliers may be able to live with food

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: Only in humans with vampire genes and in normal humans after electricity is used to revive them
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood, but there is a special serum that can replace it

reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: transfusion may turn human into ghoul instead of vampire
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: First Ancestor vampires can only be made by transfusing the blood of a First Ancestor vampire.

reproduction and feeding.Inhabited by demons: No, however Marceline is of demonic descent
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Becomes white

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Turn humans into vampires level D and E
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: If a level E drinks the blood of the Pureblood that created them, the level E becomes a level C

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Only in Castlevania: Legacy of Darkness
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Vampirism can also be brought by curses or the use of the Ebony Stone

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood, however, it is just a psychological impulse
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: The Earth and other True Ancestors can create more
Magecraft

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Life force from living beings, but only human gives them the nutrients they need
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Victim ages artificially
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Humans with Wraiths DNA can be turned into Wraiths by science

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood or food, both of them gives them nutrients
Human blood or food, both of them gives them nutrients
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: If they die, they automatically become undead vampires

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Turns humans into living low blood vampires
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: If a low blood drinks undead blood after their death, they become undead vampires
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Their saliva contains drugs that make the pain of a vampire's bite feel like pleasure and can also sensitize their victims so that only that vampire can affect the victim
Their bites contain an enzyme that causes temporary memory loss and disorientation in their victims

reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Transmitted as a disease by magic or physical contact with a vampire.
Can also be created through a ritual to Molag Bal.

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Can consume human or animal blood
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: To become full-vampires, they have to drink human blood within 28 days of turning or they will die
To transfer the curse one must accept the vampire's invitation to undeath, and then kill one's self to be reborn.

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Possibly, since they used to have a world of their own.

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human blood, but some consume life essence
Only human blood gives them the nutrients they need
Human blood and a blood substitute

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Only with humans and creates damphir
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Direct contact by a worm through a wound or orifice or using a stinger in their tongue to infects humans with the worm

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Artificial blood substitute; human blood edible but unhealthy
Only human blood may sustain them, though the Hunter somehow learned how to subsist on animal blood

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: True vampires can, but a puppet's bite is simply fatal
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: If the victim is too old for transformation, the venom will burn and cause a painful death

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Eat normal human food, only really need blood to power abilities
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Feeding is addictive for victims
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: It may be possible to make a human into a Shadowspawn through genetic manipulation, but the technology isn't presently available

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via bite: Only humans, and sometimes some metahumans

reproduction and feeding.Diet: blood, although they can eat human food, but to little effect
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: leaves them more vulnerable to vampire curse, makes them woozy

reproduction and feeding.Diet: Most can consume human or animal blood, but they can learn to eat human food to keep up appearances
reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Their saliva contains venoms that make the pain of a vampire's bite feel like pleasure and increase humans health for a short while
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: For a human to be turned into a vampire, one must drink vampire blood, be bitten by other vampires, die, buried and then be reborn and brought back from the dead, then fed blood

reproduction and feeding.Fertile: Unknown, but they are unlikely to try
reproduction and feeding.Diet: Human or animal blood, possibly other things
reproduction and feeding.Other/notes: Intentional infection

reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via transfusion: If the blood is given seconds before death. If isn’t do it right, the human became bloodbonded, not a vampire
reproduction and feeding.Reproduce via consumption of vampire blo: If isn’t do it right, the human became bloodbonded, not a vampire

reproduction and feeding.Effects on victims: Hallucinations, fever and sickness

setting characteristics.Progenitor: Homo sapiens vampiris coevolved with baseline humans as predator; speciation occurred around 400000–500000 years BP
setting characteristics.Known to Human Society: Originally solitary predators, went extinct due to "crucifix glitch" and proliferation of perpendicular lines due to human technology. Species fully recreated in late 21st century and eventually reestablished position as apex predator on a virtual reality-befuddled humanity
